alert.note: Alert for Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 5:36PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Covington. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches in a short time period are expected over the area. This very heavy rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Opp, Heath, Horn Hill, Babbie, Onycha, Wiggins, Green Bay, Beulah, Blairs, Eoda, Straughn and Huckaville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
